tit.cmt: タイトルなので左記のように略記しました。
タイトルなので、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 類聚名義抄（るいじゅみょうぎしょう）は、11世紀末から12世紀頃に日本で成立した、漢字を引くための辞典（字書）。
sen.e: "Ruiju myogisho" is a dictionary (or glossary) of Chinese characters, compiled in Japan between the late 11th century and the early 12th century.
"Ruiju myogisho" is a dictionary (or glossary) of Chinese characters, compiled in Japan between the late 11th century and the early 12th century.
Ruiju myogisho is a dictionary (or glossary) of Chinese characters, compiled in Japan between the late 11th century and the early 12th century.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 「仏」「法」「僧」の3部に分かれる。
sen.e: It consists of the following three sections: "Buddha," "Dharma," and "Sangha."
It consists of the following three sections: "Buddha," "Dharma," and "Sangha."
It consists of the following three sections: 'Buddha,' 'Dharma,' and 'Sangha.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 編者は明らかでないが、法相宗の学僧とみられる。
sen.e: Its editor is unknown but was conceivably a scholar monk.
Its editor is unknown but was conceivably a scholar monk.
Its editor is unknown but was conceivably a scholar monk.

sen.j: 略称、名義抄。
sen.e: It is abbreviated as "Myogisho."
It is abbreviated as "Myogisho."
It is abbreviated as Myogisho.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 「るいじゅうみょうぎしょう」の読みは誤り。
sen.e: It is sometimes called "Ruijuu myogisho" which is incorrect.
sen.cmt: 「るいじゅ」と「るいじゅう」の読み方の違いを明確にするため[ruijuu」としました。
sen.e: It is sometimes called "Ruijuu myogisho," which is incorrect.
It is sometimes called 'Ruiju-u myogisho,' which is incorrect.
sen.cmt: スペル、クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 今日伝わる主な本は次の通りである。
sen.e: The major manuscripts of "Ruiju myogisho" which have survived to this day are as follows.
The major manuscripts of "Ruiju myogisho" which have survived to this day are as follows.
The major manuscripts of "Ruiju myogisho" which have survived to this day are as follows.

sen.j: 図書寮（ずしょりょう）本。
sen.e: Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books) Manuscript
Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books) Manuscript
Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books) Manuscript.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 宮内庁書陵部蔵。
sen.e: This manuscript is housed in the Imperial Household Archives.
This manuscript is housed in the Imperial Household Archives.
This manuscript is housed in the Imperial Household Archives.

sen.j: 永保元年（1081年）から康和2年（1100年）頃に成立。
sen.e: It was compiled between ca. 1081 and 1100.
It was compiled between ca. 1081 and 1100.
It was compiled between ca. 1081 and 1100.

sen.j: 原撰本のおもかげを残すが、「法」部の前半しか伝わっていない。
sen.e: It retains something of the original text though only the earlier part of the Buddha section has survived.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It retains something of the original text although only the earlier part of the Buddha section has survived.
It retains something of the original text although only the earlier part of the 'Buddha' section has survived.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: したがって零本（完全ではない本）である。
sen.e: It is therefore an incomplete text.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is therefore an incomplete text.
It is therefore an incomplete text.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 字の説明には詳しい出典を付している。
sen.e: Detailed bibliography is provided for each character entry.
A detailed bibliography is provided for each character entry.
A detailed bibliography is provided for each character entry.

sen.j: 観智院（かんじいん）本。
sen.e: Kanjiin Manuscript
Kanjiin Manuscript
Kanjiin (Kanjiin Temple's) Manuscript.
sen.cmt: ピリオドなど補足しました。

sen.j: 天理図書館所蔵（国宝）。
sen.e: The Kanjiin manuscript (designated as a national treasure) is housed in the Tenri Central Library.
The Kanjiin manuscript (designated a national treasure) is housed in the Tenri Central Library.
The Kanjiin manuscript (designated a national treasure) is housed in the Tenri Central Library.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 鎌倉時代中期の書写。
sen.e: It was transcribed in the mid-Kamakura period.
It was transcribed in the mid-Kamakura period.
It was transcribed in the mid-Kamakura period.

sen.j: 原撰本を増補改編した系統の一本である。
sen.e: It belongs to a manuscript family of the enlarged and revised versions of the original text.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It belongs to a manuscript family of the enlarged and revised versions of the original text.
It belongs to a manuscript family of the enlarged and revised versions of the original text.

sen.j: 今日、完本として伝わっているのはこの本のみである。
sen.e: It is the only complete text that has come down to us.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is the only complete text that has come down to us.
It is the only complete text that has come down to us.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 「仏」「法」「僧」部がそれぞれ上中下に分かれる。
sen.e: The three sections "Buddha," "Dharma," and "Sangha" are each subdivided into three parts (Part 1 to 3).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The three sections "Buddha," "Dharma," and "Sangha" are each subdivided into three parts (Parts 1 to 3).
The three sections 'Buddha,' 'Dharma,' and 'Sangha' are each subdivided into three parts (Parts 1 to 3).

sen.j: 「仏」の下はさらに「下本」「下末」に分かれている。
sen.e: Part 3 of the Buddha section is further divided into "gehon" (A) and "gematsu" (B).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Part 3 of the Buddha section is further divided into "gehon" (A) and "gematsu" (B).
Part 3 of the 'Buddha' section is further divided into 'gehon' (A) and 'gematsu' (B).

sen.j: 高山寺本。

sen.j: 表題は「三宝類字集」。

sen.j: 改編本系。
sen.e: It has been ascribed to the family of the revised versions.

sen.j: 観智院本の「仏」部上および中の一部にあたる「巻上」のみ伝わる。
sen.e: It is incomplete with only Part 1 of the Buddha section and "Volume 1" which forms a part of Part 2.
It is incomplete, with only Part 1 of the Buddha section and "Volume 1," which forms a portion of Part 2.
It is incomplete, with only Part 1 of the 'Buddha' section and 'Volume 1,' which forms a portion of Part 2.

sen.e: Hobodaiin Manuscript

The hobodaiin manuscript is owned by Toji-Hobodai-in Temple.

sen.j: 改編本系。

sen.j: 零本。
sen.e: It is incomplete.
It is incomplete.

sen.j: そのほか、改編本系に属する蓮成院本（転写本は宮内庁書陵部蔵）、西念寺本（転写本は関西大学蔵）があるが、いずれも零本である。
sen.e: Apart from these manuscripts, the following manuscripts which also belong to the family of the revised versions are available: the Renjoin manuscript (whose duplicate copy is housed in the Imperial Household Archives) and the Seinenji manuscript (whose transcription is owned by Kansai University). Both are incomplete.

Apart from these manuscripts, the following manuscripts which also belong to the family of the revised versions are available: the Renjoin manuscript (whose duplicate copy is housed in the Imperial Household Archives) and the Seinenji manuscript (whose transcription is owned by Kansai University). Both are incomplete.

Apart from these manuscripts, the following manuscripts which also belong to the family of the revised versions are available: The Renjoin (Renjoin Temple's) manuscript (whose duplicate copy is housed in the Imperial Household Archives) and the Seinenji (Seinen-ji Temple's) manuscript (whose transcription is owned by Kansai University) and both are incomplete.
sen.cmt: 表記をかえ、一文にしました。

sen.j: 図書寮本では、漢字を字形ごとに並べて掲出し、反切（発音）・用例・和訓・和音などを多くは出典つきで記す。
sen.e: The Zushoryo manuscript lists Chinese characters by form with "hansetsu" (pronunciations), usage examples, semantic readings, and Japanese readings of Chinese characters, many of which are provided with bibliographical information.

The Zushoryo manuscript lists Chinese characters by form with "hansetsu" (pronunciations), usage examples, semantic readings, and Japanese readings of Chinese characters, many of which are provided with bibliographical information.

The Zushoryo manuscript lists Chinese characters by form with hansetsu (pronunciations), usage examples, semantic readings, and Japanese readings of Chinese characters, many of which are provided with bibliographical information.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: さらに、和訓のアクセントを点（声点）の位置によって示す場合も多い。
sen.e: Semantic readings are often marked with "dots" (shoten or tone marks) that indicate syllables on which stress falls.
Semantic readings are often marked with "dots" (shoten or tone marks) that indicate syllables on which stress falls.
Semantic readings are often marked with dots (known as shoten [tone marks]) that indicate syllables on which stress falls.

sen.j: たとえば、下記のようにある項目では、「洌」という漢字について、まず、「玉（ごく）に云ふ」と、『玉篇』の説を引用する。
sen.e: The entry for the character "洌" for instance appears like this.
The entry for the character "洌," for instance, appears as follows.

For instance, the entry for '洌' first cites the account in "Gyokuhen" (Chinese dictionary edited in the sixth century), which is indicated by the phrase '玉云' (according to "Gyoku") appears as follows:
sen.cmt: 原文が分割されていたため、ルールに従い編集しました。

sen.j: 洌 玉云、力折反。
sen.e: 洌 玉云,力折反.
洌 玉云,力折反.
洌 玉云,力折反.
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず。日本語そのものについて説明もあるため、そのまま記載しています。

sen.j: 寒皃。
sen.e: 寒皃.
寒皃.
寒皃.
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず。日本語そのものについて説明もあるため、そのまま記載しています。

sen.j: 潔也。
sen.e: 潔也.
潔也.
潔也.
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず。日本語そのものについて説明もあるため、そのまま記載しています。

sen.j: イサキヨシ易
sen.e: イサキヨシ易
イサキヨシ易
イサキヨシ易
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず。日本語そのものについて説明もあるため、そのまま記載しています。

sen.j: 「力折反」は反切で、「力」の声母と「折」の韻母を合わせた発音であると示す。
sen.e: The next phrase "力折反" describes the character's pronunciation, indicating that the first consonant of the character "力" ("l" for "li") is followed by the first vowel of "折" ("e" for "zhe").
sen.cmt: 漢字の読みは呉訓にしたがいました。
sen.e: The next phrase "力折反" describes the character's pronunciation, indicating that the first consonant of the character "力" ("l" for "li") is followed by the first vowel of "折" ("e" for "zhe").
The next phrase '力折反' describes the character's pronunciation, indicating that the first consonant of the character '力' ('l' for 'li') is followed by the first vowel of '折' ('e' for 'zhe').
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 「寒皃。潔也。」は「寒い様子。潔い。」という字義説明である。
sen.e: The third and fourth phrase, "寒皃" and "潔也" explain its semantic readings, "cold and crisp," respectively.
The third and fourth phrases, "寒皃" and "潔也," explain its semantic readings, "cold and crisp," respectively.
The third and fourth phrases, '寒皃' and '潔也,' explain its semantic readings, 'cold and crisp,' respectively.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 「イサキヨシ」は和訓で、『周易』の訓にあることを示すものとみられる。
sen.e: The last portion "イサキヨシ"denotes its Japanese reading and "易"may suggest that this reading goes back to "Zhouyi" (The Book of I-Ching, the first book ever written in Chinese).
The last portion "イサキヨシ"denotes its Japanese reading and "易"may suggest that this reading goes back to "Zhouyi" (The Book of I-Ching, the first book ever written in Chinese).
The last portion 'イサキヨシ'denotes its Japanese reading and '易' may suggest that this reading goes back to "Zhouyi" (The Book of I-Ching, the first book ever written in Chinese).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: さらに「イサキヨシ」の「イサ」の左上に声点が打ってある。
sen.e: "Shoten" (a tone mark) is placed on the upper left of the syllable "イサ" in "イサキヨシ."
"Shoten" (a tone mark) is placed on the upper left of the syllable "イサ" in "イサキヨシ."
Shoten is placed on the upper left of the syllable 'イサ' in 'イサキヨシ.'
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除し、クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 図書寮本の成立した当時、「いさぎよし」の「いさ」の部分を高く発音したことが分かる。
sen.e: The implication is that this syllable was pronounced with high pitch when the Zushoryo manuscript was compiled.
The implication is that this syllable was pronounced with high pitch when the Zushoryo manuscript was compiled.
The implication is that the syllable 'いさ' (also written as イサ) of 'いさぎよし' (also written as イサギヨシ) was pronounced with high pitch when the Zushoryo manuscript was compiled.
sen.cmt: 前文との関連で、補足しました。

sen.j: 観智院本では項目・和訓などが増補された代わりに出典が省略されている。
sen.e: The Kanjiin manuscript contains additional entries and semantic readings though it has no bibliographical information.
The Kanjiin manuscript contains additional entries and semantic readings, although it has no bibliographical information.
The Kanjiin manuscript contains additional entries and semantic readings, although it has no bibliographical information.

sen.j: たとえば、「洌」では、次のように記載されている。
sen.e: In this manuscript the entry "洌" is described as follows.
In this manuscript the entry "洌" is described as follows.

sen.cmt: 原文が分割されていたため、ルールに従い編集しました。

sen.j: 洌 力折反 スム サムシ キヨシ イサキヨシ ハ下シ
sen.e: 洌 力折反 スム サムシ キヨシ イサキヨシ ハ下シ
洌 力折反 スム サムシ キヨシ イサキヨシ ハ下シ
洌 力折反 スム サムシ キヨシ イサキヨシ ハ下シ
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず。日本語そのものについて説明もあるため、そのまま記載しています。

sen.j: このように、反切の直下に和訓が5つ並んでいる（「ハ下シ」は「はげし」）。
sen.e: Five semantic readings ("スム サムシ キヨシ イサキヨシ ハ下シ"--this last is read as "はげし" i.e., "hageshi") appear immediately after the pronunciation ("力折反").
Five semantic readings ("スム サムシ キヨシ イサキヨシ ハ下シ"--this last is read as "はげし"; i.e., "hageshi") appear immediately after the pronunciation ("力折反").
As above, five semantic readings (スム サムシ キヨシ イサキヨシ ハ下シ) ('ハ下シ' is read as 'hageshi' (はげし) appear immediately after the pronunciation.
sen.cmt: 原文が分割されていたため、ルールに従い編集しました。

sen.j: 「イサキヨシ」の「イサ」の左上に声点があり、また、「ハ下シ」の「ハ下」の左下に声点がある。
sen.e: A tone mark is placed on the upper left of "イサ"in "イサキヨシ"and another is on the lower left of "ハ下" in "ハ下シ."
A tone mark is placed on the upper left of "イサ"in "イサキヨシ"and another is placed on the lower left of "ハ下" in "ハ下シ."
Shoten is placed on the upper left of 'イサ' in 'イサキヨシ'and another is placed on the lower left of 'ハ下' in 'ハ下シ.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 観智院本の書写された当時、「はげし」の「はげ」は低く発音したことが分かる。
sen.e: This suggests that "hage" in "hageshi" was pronounced with low pitch when the manuscript was transcribed.
This suggests that "hage" in "hageshi" was pronounced with low pitch when the manuscript was transcribed.
This suggests that 'hage' (はげ) in 'hageshi' (はげし) was pronounced with low pitch when the manuscript was transcribed.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変え、日本語補足しました。

sen.j: このように、本書は種々の情報を盛り込んだ詳しい字書であるため、資料的価値が非常に高い。
sen.e: "Ruiju myogisho" is thus a highly valuable document as it is a lexicographical work with detailed and diverse information.
"Ruiju myogisho" is thus a highly valuable document, as it is a lexicographical work with detailed and diverse information.
Ruiju myogisho is thus a highly valuable document, as it is a lexicographical work with detailed and diverse information.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 日本語の分野では、平安時代末期・鎌倉時代の語彙や、単語のアクセントを知る上で貴重な資料となっている。
sen.e: Japanese linguistics has regarded it as an invaluable material for studying the vocabulary and pitch patters of words around the late Heian and the Kamakura period.
Japanese linguistics has regarded it as an invaluable material for studying the vocabulary and pitch patterns of words around the late Heian and the Kamakura periods.
